**PLEASE NOTE** that this SDK is currently for Bynder’s **internal use only**. You will not be able to generate API tokens for your Orbit account yet. We are working on it and this feature will be available soon.


Bynder Orbit Python SDK
=======================

The main goal of this SDK is to speed up the integration of Bynder Orbit
users who use Python. Making it easier to connect to the Bynder Orbit
API (`documentation <https://app.swaggerhub.com/apis/Bynder_BV/Orbit/1.0.0>`_) and execute requests on it.

Requirements and dependencies
-----------------------------

The Python SDK requires the following in order to fully work:

-  ``Python >= 3.6``, older versions of Python won't work.

Pip should handle all the dependencies automatically.

Installation
------------

This SDK depends on a few libraries in order to work, installing it with
pip should take care of everything automatically.

Before you install the SDK we recommend you to setup a virtual
environment:

.. code:: bash

    virtualenv -p python3.6 venv  # create virtual environment
    source venv/bin/activate      # activate virtual environment

After you have successfully setup a virtual environment you can install
the SDK with `pip <https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/installing/>`__. Run
the following command while your virtual environment is active.

.. code:: bash

    pip install orbit-sdk

To use the SDK, you have to import it at the top of your file:

.. code:: python

    from orbit_sdk import (OrbitClient, Configuration, Token)

How to use it
-------------

This is a simple example on how to retrieve data from Orbit. For a more
detailed example of implementation refer to the `sample
code <https://github.com/Bynder/orbit-python-sdk/blob/master/example/app.py>`__.

Before executing any request to the Bynder Orbit API we need to
instantiate the **OrbitClient** class. The **OrbitClient** expects a
**Configuration** and optionally a callback. The configuration can be
used to configure the client. The callback is a function you can create
yourself which needs to accept a token as a parameter. Your callback
function will be executed when your access\_token is expired and a new
one is generated using auto refresh. This allows you to keep track of
the latest access and refresh tokens.

.. code:: python

        api_configuration = Configuration(
            client_id=config.get('ORBIT_API', 'client_id'),
            client_secret=config.get('ORBIT_API', 'client_secret'),
            redirect_uri=config.get('ORBIT_API', 'redirect_uri')
        )

        def callback_func(token):
            print('New access token: {}'.format(token.access_token))
            print('New refresh token: {}'.format(token.refresh_token))

        orbit_client = OrbitClient(
            configuration=api_configuration,
            callback=callback_func
        )

We encourage you to store the tokens in a `configuration
file <https://docs.python.org/3/library/configparser.html>`__ or as
envrioment variables. This will help you to keep your credentials safe.

After getting the **OrbitClient** configured successfully we need to get
an instance of the **AssetClient** in order to do any of the API calls
relative to the Bynder Orbit assets:

.. code:: python

         asset_client = orbit_client.asset_client

And with this, we can start our request to the API, listed in the
**Methods Available** section following. Short example of getting all
the **Assets**:

.. code:: python

        assets = asset_client.assets()

This call will return a list with all the Assets available in Bynder
Orbit. Note that some of the calls accept a query array in order to
filter the results via the API call params. For instance, if we only
wanted to retrieve **2 images** here is what the call would look like:

.. code:: python

        two_images = asset_client.assets({
            'limit': 2,
            'extension': 'jpeg,png'
        })

Methods Available
-----------------

These are the methods currently available on the **Bynder Orbit Python
SDK**.

OrbitClient:
^^^^^^^^^^^^

The OrbitClient can be used to generate an authorize url and to create
tokens which you can use to make API requests. If you have valid tokens
you can get the asset\_client to execute API requests relative to the
Assets in Bynder Orbit.

.. code:: python

        asset_client
        authorize_url(code_verifier, state)
        token(code, code_verifier)

AssetClient:
^^^^^^^^^^^^

All calls related to the Assets in Bynder Orbit can be executed using
the AssetClient.

.. code:: python

        assets()
        asset_by_id(asset_id)
        permanent_preview_url(asset_id)
        download_url(asset_id)

Tests
-----

You can run the tests by using the command below. This will install the
packages required and execute the tests for all the clients.

.. code:: bash

    make test
